cluster_relations.rel_desc: Public protest demonstrations are said to have occurred since ancient times.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an event or type of event occurs during a specified historical time period.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Public protest demonstrations continue to occur in the present day.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an event or type of event occurs during a specified historical time period.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Strikes are presented as a tactic used since ancient times.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an event or type of event occurs during a specified historical time period.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Strikes continue to be used as a tactic in the present day.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an event or type of event occurs during a specified historical time period.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Revolutions are described as occurring since ancient times.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an event or type of event occurs during a specified historical time period.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Revolutions continue up to the present day.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an event or type of event occurs during a specified historical time period.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The 19th and 20th centuries are described as a period that included many revolutions.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a historical time period includes occurrences of specified events or event types.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The late 20th and early 21st centuries are the time frame during which protests and revolutions shaped politics.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a historical time period includes occurrences of specified events or event types.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The history of protests and revolutions is described as beginning in ancient times.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates the time point or time period when an event, process, or described history begins.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Historical Impact of Protests and Revolutions

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: starting point of the described history

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The history of protests and revolutions is said to extend up to the present day.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a described process, state, or historical span continues up to a specified end time or period.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Historical Impact of Protests and Revolutions

qualifiers.TemporalQualifier: end of the described historical span

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an event or type of event occurs within a specified historical time period.
args.justification: These six relations uniformly express that a protest-related event type (protests, strikes, revolutions) occurs within a named historical period (ancient times, present day). Renaming the predicate from 'occurs_during_time_period' to 'occurs_in_time_period' provides a shorter, more conventional, and reusable KG predicate while preserving the same semantics. All still belong to the same temporal-scope class and TEMPORALITY group.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates the historical time period in which an event, process, or described history begins.
args.justification: The current canonical name 'starts_in_time' is slightly vague about whether the object is a time instant or a period. Here the object is explicitly a historical period ('ancient times'). Renaming to 'starts_in_time_period' makes the expected object type clearer and more consistent with other time-period predicates while keeping it in the onset-related temporal class.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a described process, state, or historical span continues up to a specified end time period.
args.justification: The existing canonical name 'extends_until' does not specify that the object is a time period. In this instance, the object is the historical period 'present day'. Adjusting to 'extends_until_time_period' clarifies the expected object type and aligns with the naming of other time-period-focused temporal predicates.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an event or type of event occurs within a specified historical time period.
executed_decisions.justification: These six relations uniformly express that a protest-related event type (protests, strikes, revolutions) occurs within a named historical period (ancient times, present day). Renaming the predicate from 'occurs_during_time_period' to 'occurs_in_time_period' provides a shorter, more conventional, and reusable KG predicate while preserving the same semantics. All still belong to the same temporal-scope class and TEMPORALITY group.

Here the object is explicitly a historical period ('ancient times'). Renaming to 'starts_in_time_period' makes the expected object type clearer and more consistent with other time-period predicates while keeping it in the onset-related temporal class.

Adjusting to 'extends_until_time_period' clarifies the expected object type and aligns with the naming of other time-period-focused temporal predicates.
